intro: Centaurium arizonicum, commonly known as Arizona glory-of-the-snow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. It features a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Centaurium arizonicum is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
